alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 03 at 9:14PM AKDT until November 06 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Northeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts 55 to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty northeasterly winds are expected to develop late Friday and continue through early Sunday, with the strongest gusts occurring through the day Saturday. The most likely range for the wind gusts should be limited to the 55-65 mph range, but there is an outside chance for gusts to 75 mph. This is a developing weather system, so stay tuned for details.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
